As a Portal fan, I loved working on brain puzzles and there is some comedy, and there is a bit of a story behind the game. Though I do not believe the first Portal was as good as Portal 2, this may just be because of the fact that I played the second game first. But over all, Portal is a great game for challenging your brain.

Portal a bousculer l industrie du jeu video, j avais jamais joué a un jeu aussi original ! Le moteur source a été améliorer pour rendre au jeu un visuel de fou ! On y decouvre aperture sciences, un centre scientifique gérer par une I.A appellé GLaDOS. La machine a tué tout les scientifiques du centre et continue sa directive première, faire des salles de test et utiliser des cobailles humaines pour les résoudres. C'est une histoire asser étrange mais pourtant tellement intrigante et pertinentes. Le jeu a une communauté solide et toujours actifs qui font des mods et des maps custom sur l univers de portal 1, le meilleur auquel j ai pu joué était portal prelude, il raconte les événements ce deroulant un peu avant le branchement de GLaDOS.
If you like blue portals,go for it.
Still amazes me how revolutionary this game was and how enjoyable it is still today. I almost never go back and play finished games, but this is a forever one, and Portal 2
Has a very good story and the ending is just as good. The story was somewhat short, but luckily it has plenty of moments that'll make you laugh and keep wanting more.
simple game
bad gameplay, No blood, stoopit robots and it gave me cancer and aids

Portal was a blast. I saw people play this game before, and I always assumed by the looks of it to be a hard puzzle game only meant for the dedicated. I finally picked up Portal for myself, and was confused immediately. How do I get over there if I'm here? Luckily that didn't last. I was surprised how simple the concept was for the portals. 

I'm glad that the challenge of this game for me was to figure out how to get to the finish and not how to figure out what portals are. This game was fun difficult, a.k.a. I did not get frustrated with this game. I enjoyed figuring out how to get to where I wanted to go. 

GLaDOS was the star of the show. I've never loved a homicidal AI more than her. 

Not much of a storyline, but a story isn't need for such a fun puzzle game. You endure the trials and get your revenge and freedom. 

Why haven't you bought this game yet?

Also, there are no jump scares.
Una obra maestra de los videojuegos de puzles :D
Espetáculo. Mas te recomendo comprar Portal 2 logo em seguida, pois o jogo acaba em torno de 3-5 horas, dependendo do seu desempenho.

2007 was a good year for gaming. The Orange Box was a compalation of the Half-Life 2 games, Team Fortress 2 and the new game Portal. In Portal, you take contor of Chell in Apature Labs around the time of Half-Life. You are being watched by  a computer AI, GLaDOS who is pputting you through 19 life threating tests with the portal gun. The portal gun is a weapon that shoots two portals, one blue and the other orange. If you go through the blue portal, you exit out the orange and vice versa. Each test gets proressivly more challenging and complex. At the end of the game you must go through the backlot of the lab and face GLaDOS with one of the most satisfying endings to any game ever. 9.5/10
THIS GAME IS AMAZING!!!!!!!!! I highly recomend buying this game and it is worth every single thenth of a cent that you spend on this gem of a game!!

Alright, this game is one of my absolute favorites. Somehow, Valve managed to create a first person shooter game, that doesn't involve shooting anyone. The point of the game is to use portals to get from point A to point B, and solve puzzles, all while dodging semi-sentient turrets, deadly goo, lasers, and a highly intelligent power hungry sociopathic narcissist computer with a delusion that the cake is real. overall, I highly recommend this game, and its sequal!

Enjoy!

                    ~Fibcoa7
ich bin nahui
This game made me return to PC gaming after a decade. A "FPS" with no enemies "to kill", you progress through the puzzles that have no single solution. This game is great, everyone should try it.

LOVED IT!

Para empezar elegi comprar este juego por 3 razones:
1. Es de valve y me encantan los juegos de la compañía.
2. Estaba de oferta con su secuela a 6 dolares.
3. Lo había jugado anteriormente y me gusto bastante.

Sin embargo, este juego es mucho mejor de lo que parece.
Puntos positivos:
-Es del genero puzzle (rompecabezas) y basicamente tenemos que rompernos la cabeza para superarlo. (sin ninguna clase de guía claro) Esto se aplica a la primera vez que lo juegas. (Aviso es una muy buena experiencia si no eres muy impaciente que digamos). Por lo tanto, la jugabilidad es muy buena aunque sea en una primera impresión.
-A parte, al finalizar la campaña podemos seguir divirtiendonos completando los logros que nos quedaban, haciendo pruebas con un nivel de dificultad más alto y haciendo desafios de tiempo, de pasos, n° de portales para destruir completamente nuestra cabeza :DD
-Con respecto a la historia, parece bastante simple. Pero en cierto momento eclosiona creando un giro de trama bastante interesante... Aunque es algo predecible :/
-batalla final bastante epica la verdad. Vale totalmente la pena vivirla :)


Puntos Negativos: 
Estaría esto ultimo, la ausencia de una historia desde un primer momento (aunque esto lo va a compensar su secuela, creanme).

Puntos Neutrales: 
-el soundtrack (vamos no es la gran cosa)
-los graficos. Estamos con el motor "Source" el cual no es lo mejor del mundo (aclaro, actualmente) pero no esta mal en absoluto. Pero no deja de ser bastante realista.

En resumen es un muy buen juego: 9/10
3 three words BEST GAME EVER

Bhe cosa dire di portal.... Un ottimo puzzle game combinata con una caratteristica fps. Livelli molto ingegnosi e se non si ha mai tocato un gioco di questo tipo si troverà in difficolta in certi momenti del gioco. Purtroppo non è lunghissimo e lo si può finire benissimo in 3 ore circa. La battaglia con Glados (il nemico principale del gioco per chi non lo sapesse) è abbastanza semplice e veloce. Ma in ogni caso è un ottimo gioco di "mamma" Valve e prende un bel 8/10 da parte mia. Piccola curiosità, Portal e half-life sono ambientati nello stesso "universo".

Portal:

[h1]Positives:[/h1]

+ The game is cleverly designed and quite creative. Using a portal gun, you can shoot blue and orange coloured portals which link to eachother. By thinking carefully about how these portals interact, you can travel vast distances with speed, transfer objects like boxes from one place to the next and much more. 
+ Most of the (limited) dialogue featured in the game is humourous in nature, providing a few laughs. 

[h1]Mixed:[/h1]

~ The graphics are ok, Portal is fairly old as of 2015 so this isn't surprising. Not the main reason you buy a puzzle game to begin with, but it still forms part of the experience. 

[h1]Negatives:[/h1]

- The majority of puzzles are quite easy, the first 14 of 19 are a complete breeze, with the others being somewhat difficult and a bit more lengthy. Only the advanced chambers pose any sort of cognitive challenge and can be a little frustrating, but achievable. 
- Around 10-15 hours of content, including the advanced chamber puzzles and challenges. The normal base game can be finished in around 3-4 hours, which is pretty horrendous.
- Non-existent story. A computer program called Glados, from the Aperture Science Laboratory, puts you through a series of puzzles before attempting to kill you. For what reasons, nobody knows. Why you're in Aperture Science in the first place is not explained, there is no back-story at all. 

Overall Score 6.5/10

Portal is not deserving of a 90/100 metacritic score and it seems to be hugely overrated by the Steam Community. It's not a bad game, but it's far from flawless. It's a very intriguing game that introduces some new concepts to the puzzle genre with the portal gun. In this way it is rather unique. With that said, it's pretty short in duration, has no plotline whatsoever and many of the puzzles are not taxing on your mind.

Make sure you get this on sale, it's absolutely essential that you don't pay full price.
很好的游戏，就是太短了，开发者注释模式好评，结尾的歌好评

Me Surpreendeu!
Eu pensava que esse jogo iria ser meio "blé", mas eu até que curti bastante!
Apesar de não ser um fã de jogos em 3D, esse sim é um jogo bem dahora que me viciou* do nada!

Bem, em relação a Portal, não cabe a mim te dizer se vai gostar ou não do jogo assim como a maioria das pessoas que jogaram. Porém, eu lhe garanto que se gosta de Puzzle, vai se divertir bastante!

*Viciei em certas coisas do jogo, não dele como um todo.

Upon waking up trapped in an unfamiliar laboratory facility, you find yourself to be an experimental test subject, led by an unknown AI through deadly puzzles with the promise of cake at the finish line.

The genre defining Portal still provides an incredible experience after so many years after its original release. Blending a fantastic mixture of an interesting storyline, challenging puzzles and original game mechanics, this game really is a ''must-have" for any gamer's Steam Library.

Pros:
+ Original and fun game mechanics
+ Fantastic storyline
+ Interesting puzzles
+ Advanced levels and portal/steps/time challenges
+ The robot turrets are ridiculously cute!

Cons:
- Main story is a bit short

My Score: 9.5/10

Portal is a Fun Challenging Original Puzzle Game made by Valve Corporation. It brings Skill, Challenges, and Cake to the Table. At first it starts off Easy but gets Harder as you Advance in the Game. Once you Learn the ways of Portal it will be a Piece Of Cake! (Pun Intended) The Portal Gun will Navigate you anywhere you want. Using Portals you can get anywhere faster then you normally would. The Price of $10.99 is an Amazing Deal for this game. You can spend Hours upon Hours just screwing around with the Portal Gun. So what are you waiting for? Buy Portal, Dim the Lights, and grab yourself some Cake for this Great Puzzle Game!
10/10
Quite a bit shorter than Portal 2, but what the heck, it was still awesome! But I have to admit, I had to use a guide for one part....
Its awesome to get back to the beginning of portal. A puzzle game with a simple yet very effective mechanic that sets it apart from the rest.
This game is short but really fun. People who like puzzle games then this is the game for you, also go check out portal 2

When I played it myselfm, however, I could follow movements perfectly and fully enjoy it.  It's a really puzzling game that makes you think, and it is really atmospheric too.  The challenges are near impossible for me though.

Portal - одна из моих любимейших игр, не только из-за пространственных загадок, но и за лаконичный дизайн и продуманность каждого уголка в игровом пространстве. Команда студентов из колледжа DigiPen, вошедших в состав Valve благодаря игре Narbacular Drop, смогли на основе концепции двух связянных порталов создать удивительное по своей природе развлечение.
 
 Это одна из немногих игр, содержащих в себе черты серьезной головоломки и захватывающего приключения. Сюжет (пусть его и мало) создан со свойственным Valve вкусом и очень бережно вписан в игровой процесс "одна тестовая камера за другой". Да и техническая реализация такого заведомо непростого проекта как Portal, как всегда, на высоте.

 Теперь же, после прекрасной Portal 2, очевидно, что первая игра была своего рода "полигоном", или, если хотите, "проверкой концепции на жизнедеятельность". Гейб Ньюэлл и компания поступили очень разумно - сначала выпустили игру не отдельно, а в составе сборника The Orange Box, ведь никто не мог бы заранее догадаться насколько успешной будет идея с порталами.

 И, наконец, Portal - игра, которую можно рекомендовать абсолютно всем, - каждому, кто способен управляться с мышью и клавиатурой.
It's Portal, it's a good game, just buy it.
